CatDescriptText: Mr. Gene Boseman, 742 Idlewild Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 7, 1958, pg. 3 with question: "Do you think adults in community are doing enough to foster constructive recreational activities, like playgrounds, centers, places to dance, Little Leagues, etc., for youth?" answer reads: "I don't think that we have adequate facilities or enough leaders."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Gene Boseman wearing moustache and dark trench coat, holding newspaper under left arm, standing with hands in pockets in front of block wall with hat display in store window on right
